page.title: 04TEDDINGTON TOWN CENTRE
page.content: { Teddington}is a small town, 17 kms from the centre of London, part of the vast and almost continuous urban area to the west of the capital.{ The main {road}through the town is{Broad Street which has{83 shop units.} Most of these are in terraces, broken only by sid estreets, and the shops have flats or offices above them. Shops are mainly for{occasional use}eg. clothing {(31%), services}eg. the post office {(24%),}and{everyday needs}eg.groceries {(19%).} There are only a few scattered chain stores: Bejam for freezer food, Woolworth, Boots and Tesco. Tesco is the most popular store and has it's own car park. {Teddington caters mainly for day to {day family shopping}and is usually busy. For more specialised shopping local people go to the nearby centres of Kingston, Richmond and Hounslow.
